adsorption_measurements.preparation: Fresh sample of HBU-20 (∼300 mg) was immersed in acetone for five days, and fresh solvent was exchanged every 12 h to remove the high boiling solvent molecules completely. Then the powder was activated at 50 °C for 24 h and collected for further gas adsorption analyses. After vacuum degassing at 60 °C for 12 h, N2 adsorption isotherm was achieved at 77 K, while other selected gas adsorption determinations were performed at 273 K and 298 K, respectively. Dynamic breakthrough separation experiments were implemented at 298 K.

SO2/CO2.conditions: 0.1 (SO2): 9.9 (CO2 or CH4): 40 (N2) gas mixtures flowed through the activated samples packed into the same glass column (1.0 cm inner diameter, 7.0 cm in length). The gas mixture passed through the column at a rate of 50 mL/min.
